Based on the preferences provided, I would recommend two movies from this list: "Find Me Guilty" (2006) directed by Ron Silver, starring Tim Pigott-Smith and Nicholas Farrell. The movie is based on a real-life trial in New York City involving Jackie DiNorscio, who was later found dead in her prison cell.
Another recommendation would be "Bloody Sunday" (2002) directed by Neil Diamond, starring Jet Li. The movie is based on the real-life events that occurred on January 30, 1972, in Northern Ireland when British soldiers opened fire on a peaceful civil rights protest march during which a sadistic British officer murdered his son.
Both of these movies are highly rated and have received critical acclaim. They both explore themes of justice, revenge, and the power of organized resistance against oppressive regimes.
